definition: A term referring to the path or course followed by a body of water, typically a river or stream, as it flows through a landscape. It is commonly used in geographical and environmental contexts to describe the trajectory or route taken by a river or stream.

examples.german: Der Flusslauf erstreckt sich über mehrere Kilometer.
examples.english: The course of the river extends over several kilometers.

examples.german: Der Flusslauf wird durch Dämme und Kanäle beeinflusst.
examples.english: The course of the river is influenced by dams and canals.

examples.german: Der Flusslauf mündet in den See.
examples.english: The course of the river flows into the lake.

examples.german: Der Flusslauf ist von üppiger Vegetation umgeben.
examples.english: The course of the river is surrounded by lush vegetation.

examples.german: Der Flusslauf weist viele Kurven und Schleifen auf.
examples.english: The course of the river has many curves and loops.
